title: How to Disable Microsoft Narrator at Start Up

steps.title: Press Win.
steps.content: Press Win . This shortcut will work on both Windows 10 and 11. Pressing Windows key + Ctrl + Enter at the same time instantly turns off Narrator.

steps.title: Open your Windows Settings .
steps.content: Open your Windows Settings . You'll find this gear icon in your Start menu.

steps.title: Click Ease of Access.
steps.content: Click Ease of Access . You'll see this on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Click Narrator.
steps.content: Click Narrator . It's on the left panel.

steps.title: Click the switch to turn off Narrator .
steps.content: Click the switch to turn off Narrator . Narrator is now disabled.

steps.title: Force-quit Narrator.
steps.content: Force-quit Narrator. If Narrator won't stop reading on-screen text long enough to allow you to do anything, you can force it to quit by doing the following: Press Ctrl + â‡§ Shift + Esc to bring up the Task Manager program. Find and click the Screen Reader option in the list of programs on the Processes tab. Double-click End task in the bottom-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Open your Windows Settings .
steps.content: Open your Windows Settings . You'll find this gear icon in your Start menu.

steps.title: Click Accessibility.
steps.content: Click Accessibility . It's in the left panel.

steps.title: Click Narrator.
steps.content: Click Narrator . This is in the right panel.

steps.title: Click the switch to turn off Narrator .
steps.content: Click the switch to turn off Narrator . Narrator will no longer start automatically on your PC.
